column4: i accidentally installed the i386 version of ubuntu...is there an easy way to go to x86_64 or do i need to reinstall again?
We strongly suggest new users go with 32 until they are up to speed
define up to speed....i generally kknow what im doing on linux...
Do you understand chroot and 32bit environments on a 64 bit box
no i do not because ive never had to do it when i used 64 bit :)
flash seems to also give 64's a few problems
does 64bit give anything other than more ram?
Marginal speed improvement but hardly noticable for many
sudo apt-get install fusion-icon
did you enable universe
why have i never had to do that before?
it is a fact of life
Have patience and wait for an answer and stop repeating
and gold-bug after login on the live cd the boot hangs on a beige screen
dont use sudo su
ok well just please tell me the password...so i can sudo fdisk
it is your regular user password, as long as you are not an added user to the admin account'

livecd doesnt require it.
yes
You are treading in a grey area reserved for trolls..
